intro: Nestoria albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower nestoria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
